intro.message: Join the Kittyclub, get validated by two other members and discover all benefits that come with a validated cat.

intro2.message: The Kittyclub is a social experiment.

watis.message: The Kittyclub, created by A-Labs, is a beta test for a decentralized social tool. We want to learn how people interact with this new tool and how they interact with each other within the app. Because of it’s straight forward content and it’s limited functionalities, we aim to learn and improve fast.

watis3.message: Decentralized is the absence of a central authority, of central storage… By being decentralized, the Kittyclub is an autonomous application, owned by everyone and no one. To make this real, we use the blockchain- technology, more in specific, the

watis4.message: . A-Labs, being a digital innovation lab, wants to try out these technologies to improve a community.

hoewerkttxt.message: By opening the Kittyclub app, you become a new member. Once member of the Kittyclub, you can pick a cat, name it and have it validated by two other validated members. Once your kitty has two validations, you can open the Kittybox and start validating 3 other new members.

endmsg1.message: The KittyClub was created and developed by A-Labs, the digital innovation lab of City of Antwerp.

whitepaperondertitel1.message: The Kittyclub is a social experiment.

whitepapertxt1.message: The Kittyclub, created by A-Labs, is a beta test for a decentralized social tool. We want to learn how people interact with this new tool and how they interact with each other within the app. Because of it’s straight forward content and it’s limited functionalities, we aim to learn and improve fast.

whitepapertxt1b.message: Decentralized is the absence of a central authority, of central storage… By being decentralized, the Kittyclub is an autonomous application, owned by everyone and no one. To make this real, we use the blockchain- technology, more in specific, the Ethereum protocol. A-Labs, being a digital innovation lab, wants to try out these technologies to improve a community.

whitepapertxt2.message: By opening the Kittyclub app, you become a new member. Once member of the Kittyclub, you can pick a cat, name it and have it validated by two other validated members. Once your kitty has two validations, you can open the Kittybox and start validating 3 other new members.

whitepapertech1txt.message: A database, distributed over the entire network and maintained by miners, recalculating transactions. By combining decentralized architecture, encryption and verification by miners, the blockchain coordinates the approval of all parties.

whitepapertech2txt.message: A decentralized platform for smart contracts, that runs applications without intermediaries, without risk of downtown, censorship or fraude.

whitepapertech3txt.message: The cryptocurrency of Ethereum  needed to execute a smart contract. The Ethereum miners are paid in Ether.

whitepapertech4txt.message: Computerprotocols that facilitate, verify or ratify the negotiation or execution of a contract.

whitepaperactie1txta.message: A wallet with private and public key and an account balance are created and stored locally on my device.

whitepaperactie1txtb.message: A new line is added on the membershipcontract in Ethereum,  my new membershipaccount is added.

whitepaperactie1txtc.message: A validationcontract for my account is created in Ethereum.

whitepaperactie1txtd.message: I recieve 1,1 ether in my wallet.

whitepaperactie2titel.message: I choose a picture and a name for my cat

whitepaperactie2txta.message: These data will only be stored locally on my device.

whitepaperactie3titel.message: To get my kitty validated, I request the pincode of a member with a validated kitty

whitepaperactie3txta.message: Over MQTT a message is sent to the topic “.../pincode-validator”. This message contains the picture and name of my kitty who is getting validated, the command “validate my kitty”, my pincode and my validationcontractadress.

whitepaperactie3txtb.message: The validator receives this message over MQTT from the topic “.../pincode-validator” and his app shows the data he will be validating.

whitepaperactie4titel.message: The validator confirms the data in the app

whitepaperactie4txta.message: Over MQTT a message is sent to the topic “.../pincode-aanvrager”. This message contains “validation ok”.

whitepaperactie4txtb.message: +1 validation is added on the validation contract of the new member.

whitepaperactie4txtc.message: 1 ether from the validator’s wallet is sent to the wallet of the new member, i.o.w. validating someone costs 1 ether.

whitepaperactie4txtd.message: Over MQTT the new member gets a confirmation from the validator.

whitepaperactie5titel.message: I request a second validation from  another member.

whitepaperactie5txta.message: All steps as described above are repeated.

whitepaperactie5txtb.message: New features are enabled once the validationcontract has two validations: opening the box and the ability to validate a new member.

whitepaperactie6titel.message: To open the box, I enter the box’s pincode in the app

whitepaperactie6txta.message: Over MQTT a message is sent to the topic “.../pincode-box”. This message contains my  validationcontractadress, my pincode and the command “check contract”.

whitepaperactie6txtb.message: The box receives this message and checks the number of validations on my validationcontract.

whitepaperactie6txtc.message: The box opens if there are two validations on my validationcontract.

whitepaperactie6txtd.message: A new pincode is generated for the box.

whitepaperactie7txta.message: Over MQTT a message is sent to the topic “.../pincode-box”. This message contains the command “close box”. The box receives this message and closes.

whitepapertxt8a.message: A decentralized network has to be autonomous. It can expand and is supported by a community, without central nodes. To achieve this, Ehtereum calculates a gas cost, the cost of executing a transaction. This cost is called “gas”. A small amount of gas is needed to execute a transaction.

whitepapertxt8b.message: In the Kitty Club-demo, we push this a little further and we apply ‘social economics’: we add a value to the validating itself: 1 validation = 1 ether. For every validation, the validator pays a small cost. Validating a kitty costs 1 ether. The validated kitty receives this ether. This keeps every node in the network equal so no one node can achieve a more central or more important position in the network (f.i. one node that does 100 validations).

whitepapertxt8c.message: In practice, every new member gets 1,1 ether in their wallet. Per validation, 1 ether is added. When the kitty is fully validated, the member has a balance of 3,1 ether: 1,1 when the account is created, 1, 0 with first validation, 1,0 with second validation. With these 3,1 ether, the member can validate 3 other kitties and execute actions on the smart contracts. This mechanism protects the decentral network structure of the club.

whitepapertitel9.message: What do we want to learn from the Kittyclub?

whitepapertxt9a.message: Is Ethereum the right protocol for these kind of application?

whitepapertxt9b.message: Is the interaction with a blockchain from the front-endapp (Polymer) userfriendly?

whitepapertxt9c.message: Is the architecture of the two contracts correct?

whitepapertxt9d.message: Are these two contracts sufficient or do we need more?

whitepapertitel10.message: Are there any tech pitfalls that can make the system fail?

whitepapertxt10a.message: How many members are created by the hour, by day?

whitepapertxt10b.message: How many members get validated by the hour, by day?

whitepapertxt10c.message: How many members get no validations?

whitepapertxt10d.message: How many members use all validation options?

whitepapertxt10e.message: How many people come asking for help?

whitepapertxt10f.message: Do the social economics work as foreseen?

whitepapertxt10g.message: Can we read from membershipcontract what time a new member assigns?

whitepapertitel11.message: How does the app influence the participants?

whitepapertxt11a.message: Do the participants see the potential of the app? Do they see the potential beyond the Kittyclub?

whitepapertxt11b.message: Does the netwerk expand beyond the closed community of colleagues, f.e. at home?

whitepapertxt11c.message: Do the participants search for more information about the technology? Or are they not interested?
